alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; Middle Rio Grande Valley; Sandia and Manzano Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued June 15 at 1:20PM MDT until June 15 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT THROUGH 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR PORTIONS OF CENTRAL AND EAST-CENTRAL NEW MEXICO DUE TO VERY LOW HUMIDITY, STRONG WINDS, AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...RED FLAG WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM TO 8 PM MDT FRIDAY ACROSS SOUTHWESTERN, WEST CENTRAL, CENTRAL, AND PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN NEW MEXICO DUE TO VERY LOW HUMIDITY, STRONG WINDS AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING ACROSS SOUTHWESTERN, WEST CENTRAL, CENTRAL, AND PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN NEW MEXICO DUE TO VERY LOW HUMIDITY, STRONG WINDS AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .Hot, dry and unstable conditions will prevail across the area through at least Saturday, with gusty westerly winds during the afternoon and evening bringing several hours of critical fire weather conditions to much of north central and west central New Mexico. Any fires that develop over the next few days will have the potential for significant growth in receptive fuel beds. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM TO 8 PM MDT FRIDAY... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Red Flag Warning...which is in effect from 1 PM to 8 PM MDT Friday. A Fire Weather Watch has also been issued. This Fire Weather Watch is in effect from Saturday afternoon through Saturday evening. * AREA AND TIMING...Red Flag conditions today and Friday in the Middle Rio Grande Valley (Zone 106), Sandia and Manzano Mountains (Zone 124), and Central Highlands (Zone 125) from noon to 9 pm MDT. A Fire Weather Watch is also in effect for Saturday afternoon and early evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West southwest 20 to 25 mph with occasional gusts up to 35 mph each afternoon. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Minimum values of 7 to 12 percent each afternoon. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of these Red Flag Warnings and Fire Weather Watch.

area.areaDesc: Central Highlands; Middle Rio Grande Valley; Sandia and Manzano Mountains
